ray_cluster_connection_guide.description: Configuration guide for Ray cluster connections

start_new_cluster.description: Start a new Ray cluster (head node) - defaults to 1 CPU
start_new_cluster.note: If num_cpus is not specified, defaults to 1 CPU

connect_to_existing_cluster.description: Connect to an existing Ray cluster

OPENAI_API_KEY.description: OpenAI API key for natural language prompt processing
OPENAI_API_KEY.note: Required for all natural language parsing functionality

LLM_MODEL.note: Optional - defaults to gpt-3.5-turbo if not specified

GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS.description: Path to Google Cloud service account JSON key file for GKE authentication
GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS.note: Required for Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) functionality

AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.description: AWS access key ID for EKS authentication
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.note: Required for Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) functionality

AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.description: AWS secret access key for EKS authentication
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.note: Required for Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) functionality

AWS_DEFAULT_REGION.description: Default AWS region for EKS operations
AWS_DEFAULT_REGION.note: Optional - can be overridden in cloud tool commands

RAY_ADDRESS.description: Default Ray cluster address (leave empty to use tool parameters)

RAY_MCP_ENHANCED_OUTPUT.description: If set to 'true', tool responses will be wrapped with a system prompt for LLM suggestions and next steps. Default is 'false' (plain JSON output).

example_workflow: Use init_ray tool to create local cluster
Use init_ray tool with production cluster address
